title: WASM + Innative float parsing crash

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: S-waiting-on-author
labels.description: Status: This is awaiting some action (such as code changes or more information) from the author.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a regression report! 🐛 A regression is something that changed between versions of Rust but was not supposed to.

Please provide a short summary of the regression, along with any information you feel is relevant to replicate it.
-->

### Code

I tried this code:

```rust
let float: f64 = "41.1".parse();
```

When compiled to target `wasm32-wasi`, and then compiled from WASM to a shared library by inNative with optimizations enabled in both steps, this causes the entire program to crash (not panic).

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: Any version before 2021-07-17

### Version with regression

<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0-nightly (c1026539b 2021-10-15)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: c1026539bd22e9d070988deaa47b1360cbc76436
commit-date: 2021-10-15
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.57.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

Commit 8752b403695a8830913571f0fd5ebfcf1483db37 seems to have caused the regression.

<!--
If you know when this regression occurred, please add a line like below, replacing `{channel}` with one of stable, beta, or nightly.

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-nightly -regression-untriaged
-->
